lead_paragraph: “The gods of Silicon Valley have repeatedly sought to take the companies they founded public while retaining control as if they were still private,” Steven M. Davidoff writes in the Deal Professor column. “Recent events at Google and other technology companies show that perhaps this control may be bad not only for the companies but also for the founders, who are increasingly living in a world bereft of checks and balances.”

headline.main: Tech Titans Without Checks and Balances
